justification: The STAI is utilized to detect the anxiety level of participants, with the STAI-Y2 version assessing trait anxiety as a stable characteristic and state anxiety. High anxiety is categorized with scores above 44.
The Montreal Cognitive Assessment is used to screen cognitive status, assessing various cognitive functions including memory, attention, and visuospatial and executive functions.

measured_by: Functional Fitness Battery (including Four Square Test, Functional Reach Test, Time Up and Go Test, and basic balance tasks)
justification: Functional fitness is evaluated through tasks suited for older people, measuring their abilities in balance, walking, and other physical tasks relevant to daily life.

measured_by: Event-Related Potential (ERP) Analysis during Discriminative Response Task (DRT)
justification: ERP analysis during the DRT shows preparatory brain activity, focusing on the prefrontal negativity wave, which is related to the top-down activity of the prefrontal cortex.
The DRT measures cognitive performance and processing efficiency, as well as factors such as response time and accuracy, which are analyzed through behavioral data.
